intro: Meibomia skinneri, commonly known as the slender meibomia, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Its leaves are opposite and often have a hairy texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Meibomia skinneri is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
